resources.string: The front entrance of The Cleveland Museum of Art, a neoclassical building with tall columns and a statue of The Thinker in front.
Museum gallery with a knight in armor on horseback, surrounded by medieval displays and visitors.
Founded in 1913, The Cleveland Museum of Art houses over 66,500 artworks spanning 6,000 years, renowned for its quality and breadth.
The front entrance of the Harvard Art Museums, a red brick building with large windows, elegant stone steps, and a carved sign displaying the museum name.
A grand interior courtyard of the Harvard Art Museums, featuring classical stone archways, modern glass walls, and a skylight ceiling.
Comprising the Fogg, Busch-Reisinger, and Arthur M. Sackler Museums, the Harvard Art Museums offer over 50 galleries of art across three floors, welcoming visitors from around the world.
